What is Propogation Delay/Transmission delay (a) ??
Very helpful!
Welcome back
B.Tech. Raa babu.... BTEC kaduu
Propagation delay means amount of time required to send the packet from source to destination
@isharaj143  I think Propagation delay is the time to propagate the token and transmission delay is what you described.

@pulkitahuja4750  Propagation delay is affected by the distance between source and destination, transmission delay isn't. The order of magnitude of these two elements are microseconds for transmission delay and millisecond for propagation delay.  The propagation is infact the time the physical signal goes from the source to the destination and is calculated d(distance)/v(velocity), instead transmission delay is the time the node puts on the output link the data and is calculated L(bit)/B(velocity of transmission or bitrate in bit/s)
